qas.question: What were the names of the 2 British colony's in Florida

answers.text: British East Florida and British West Florida

qas.question: Who was given Florida land grants

answers.text: officers and soldiers who had fought in the French and Indian War in order to encourage settlement

qas.question: Where did a large number of British Colonist come to florida from

answers.text: coming from South Carolina, Georgia and England though there was also a group of settlers who came from the colony of Bermuda

qas.question: The first Permanent Colony in Florida is Now known as

answers.text: what is now Duval County, Baker County, St. Johns County and Nassau County
the cultivation of sugar cane, indigo and fruits as well the export of lumber

qas.question: Which country divided Florida into North and South Florida?
Who was not given Florida land grants
What is the last permanent colony known as?
What did the British not introduce?
What did the British not export?

context: <b5_0>The British<b5_0/> divided Florida into the two colonies of <a0_0>British East Florida and British West Florida<a0_0/>. The British government gave land grants to <a1_0><b6_0>officers and soldiers<b6_0/> who had fought in the French and Indian War in order to encourage settlement<a1_0/>. In order to induce settlers to move to the two new colonies reports of the natural wealth of Florida were published in England. A large number of British colonists who were "energetic and of good character" moved to Florida, mostly <a2_0>coming from South Carolina, Georgia and England though there was also a group of settlers who came from the colony of Bermuda<a2_0/>. This would be the first permanent English-speaking population in <a3_0>what is now <b7_0>Duval County<b7_0/>, Baker County, St. Johns County and Nassau County<a3_0/>. The British built good public roads and introduced <a4_0>the cultivation of <b8_0>sugar cane<b8_0/>, indigo and fruits as well the export of <b9_0>lumber<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
